coursesHE.title: Level 3 Diploma in Business Studies
coursesHE.description: This is an intensive yet rewarding course which is intended to provide a qualification equivalent to three A-levels, recognised by universities as sufficient for entry to business and finance related degree courses such as accountancy, actuarial science, banking and finance, business administration, economics, financial services, insurance and international trade. Throughout the course, you will delve into an array of units that can prepare you for the business and finance career you want to work towards. From financial accounting and business financing to economics and financial markets. With a broad scope, you can use this knowledge to progress into a specified area of study in business and finance. You will also be developing a wide range of academic study skills on the course, from essay writing to using ICT, leading you towards the Independent Academic Study unit, where you will have the chance to experience what producing a dissertation will be like, once you move onto university.
courseContent: Marketing Principles and Implications for Business
The Nature and Context of Business
Giving a presentation to an audience

entryRequirements.education: Level 2 in Maths and English [GCSE at grade 4 (GCSE Grade C) or above]
entryRequirements.language: If your first language is not English, you need an IELTS score of 5.5 or higher.

duration.hybrid: 3 months online + 6 months in Reading, UK

coursesHE.importantNote: To obtain the full Access to Higher Education Diploma in Business Studies, students must complete at least 50% of the course within the UK or provide a valid UK address as required by QAA. Students who are unable to travel to the UK or wish to complete the entire course outside of the UK will receive Level 3 Diploma in Business Management upon successful completion of the programme. The Level 3 Diploma is validated by Open College Network South East Region (trading as Laser Learning Awards).

coursesHE.title: Level 3 Diploma in Computing
coursesHE.description: This is an intensive yet rewarding course which is intended to provide a qualification equivalent to three A-levels, recognised by universities as sufficient for entry to computing-related degree courses such as computing, computer science, information technology and game design. Throughout the course, you will delve into an array of units that can prepare you for the IT career you want to work towards. From computer architecture and web design to cyber security and database management. With a broad scope, you can use this knowledge to progress into a specified area of computing study. You will also be developing a wide range of academic study skills on the course, from essay writing to using ICT, leading you towards the Independent Academic Study unit, where you will have the chance to experience what producing a dissertation will be like, once you move onto university.
courseContent: Computer Networks and Data Communications (6 credits)
Operating Systems and System Tools (3 credits)
Setting Up and Populating Tables in a Database Application (3 credits)
The Nature and Context of Business (3 credits)
The Nature & Applications of Statistics (3 credits)
Giving a presentation to an audience (3 credits)
Skills for study: Essay writing (3 credits)

entryRequirements.education: Level 2 in Maths and English [GCSE at grade 4 (GCSE Grade C) or above]
entryRequirements.language: If your first language is not English, you need an IELTS score of 5.5 or higher.

duration.hybrid: 3 months online + 6 months in Reading, UK

coursesHE.importantNote: To obtain the full Access to Higher Education Diploma in Computing, international students must complete at least 50% of the course within the UK or provide a valid UK address as required by QAA. Students who are unable to travel to the UK or wish to complete the entire course outside of the UK will receive Level 3 Diploma in Computer Science upon successful completion of the programme. The Level 3 Diploma is validated by Open College Network South East Region (trading as Laser Learning Awards).

coursesHE.title: Level 3 Diploma in Creative Computing and Esports
coursesHE.description: Designed to open doors to higher education and careers in creative computing and esports. Suitable for career changers, returnees to education, and those pursuing a passion.
courseContent: Computer Game Creation and Design (3 credits)
Creating a VR Demo Prototype (3 credits)
Creation of a 3D Animation Scene (3 credits)
Game Production using a Game Engine (3 credits)
Storytelling for a Creative Computing Project (3 credits)
Ethics and Legislation in Esports (3 credits)
The Origin of Esports and Careers (3 credits)
Using Social Media to Market Esports (3 credits)

coursesPD.title: Professional Diploma in Digital Marketing and E-Commerce
coursesPD.description: Get on the fast track to a career in digital marketing. In this Professional Diploma programme, you’ll learn in-demand skills at your own pace, no degree or experience required.
learningOutcomes: Learn the fundamentals of digital marketing and e-commerce to gain the skills needed to land an entry-level job.
Measure marketing performance through analytics and present insights.
Attract and engage customers through digital marketing channels like search and email.
Build e-commerce stores, analyze online performance, and grow customer loyalty.
courseContent: Attract and Engage Customers with Digital Marketing

coursesPD.title: Professional Diploma in Digital Content Creation
coursesPD.description: Launch your career in content creation. Leverage AI and build the skills needed to go from newbie to pro while earning a credential that opens doors. No experience necessary.
learningOutcomes: Understand the principles of visual storytelling and design.
Develop a social media engagement strategy to create a strong brand presence.
Explore timesaving tips and AI-powered tools.
Produce diverse digital content like videos, podcasts, and infographics.

topics: Understand and apply basic visual design principles.
Gain hands-on experience with Adobe Express.
Build a portfolio showcasing design expertise.
Maintain a cohesive social media presence.
Analyze social media metrics to improve strategy.

coursesPD.title: Professional Diploma in Software Development
coursesPD.description: Prepare for a career as a full stack developer. Build job-ready skills – and must-have AI skills – for an in-demand career. In this Professional Diploma programme, you’ll learn in-demand skills at your own pace, no degree or experience required.
learningOutcomes: Develop with front-end technologies like HTML, CSS, JavaScript, React, and Bootstrap.
Deploy applications using Cloud Native methodologies and tools.
Program applications using back-end languages and frameworks like Express, Node.js, Python, and Django.
Build a GitHub portfolio with multiple hands-on projects.

coursesPD.title: Professional Diploma in Graphic Design
learningOutcomes: Gain proficiency in Photoshop, Illustrator, and Figma.
Create logos, covers, and UI for games.
Design marketing materials such as web banners and print.
Build a professional portfolio.
course_content: Designing with GenAI and Capstone Project

coursesPD.title: Professional Diploma in UX Design
learningOutcomes: Follow the UX design process (empathize, define, ideate, prototype, test).
Conduct UX research including interviews and usability studies.
Apply user-centered design, accessibility, and equity-focused design.
Create a professional UX portfolio with end-to-end projects.

coursesWork2LearnDegree.title: Level 4 Diploma in Artificial Intelligence
coursesWork2LearnDegree.description: The Level 4 Diploma in Artificial Intelligence offers a comprehensive introduction to AI, focusing on key concepts, machine learning, data science, and ethical considerations.
courseContent: Introduction to Artificial Intelligence and Applications
learning_outcomes: Demonstrate a fundamental understanding of artificial intelligence concepts, theories, and principles.
Apply machine learning algorithms and techniques to solve real-world problems.
Analyze and process data for AI applications, including data cleaning, transformation, and feature engineering.
Develop basic AI solutions using programming languages such as Python.
Evaluate the ethical and legal considerations associated with AI technologies.
Distinguish various impacts of AI on society, economy, and industry.
